#Text=Maintain Psychological Health

#Text=The World Health Organization describes psychological , or mental , health as " a state of well-being in which the individual realizes his or her own abilities , can cope with the normal stresses of life , can work productively and fruitfully , and is able to make a contribution to his or her community . "

column1: #Text=Just like physical health , mental health needs to be maintained during times of low emotional stress , in order to make you resilient to future troubles .
#Text=Doctors believe that psychological and physical health are perpetually linked , and both should be actively maintained .
#Text=There are a number of ways you can promote mental health , through physical activity , lifestyle changes , community contact and more .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Physical Maintenance
#Text=Eat a balanced diet .
#Text=Good nutrition can give you all the nutrients your body needs to be physically and mentally well .
#Text=Overeating and eating junk food are negative influences that can affect your mood , weight and self-confidence .
#Text=Exercise regularly .
#Text=Cardiovascular exercise releases endorphins , which lift your mood and positively affect your quality of life .
#Text=Exercise also builds self confidence in managing your life .
#Text=Sleep well .
#Text=Resting your mind for at least 8 hours per day through sleep helps to manage stress and improve your physical and emotional well-being .
#Text=High stress and lack of sleep can compromise your immune system and create opportunity for sickness .
#Text=Get a dose of sunlight to help your mood .
#Text=Sunlight produces serotonin in your brain , a mood-enhancing chemical .
#Text=Doctors suggest you go outside and sit in the sun for 15 minutes a day , or 30 minutes if you need a big mood boost .
#Text=Some people suffer from Seasonal Affective Disorder ( SAD ) , a depression caused by lack of sunlight .
#Text=It is common in northern climates where people do n't see direct sunlight for months .
#Text=If you feel you might have this condition , consult your doctor .
#Text=You can buy indoor full spectrum lights that have been shown to improve this condition .
#Text=Limit your intake of alcohol .
#Text=Although alcoholic substances can make you feel happy on a short-term basis , they are a depressant .
#Text=High intake of alcohol can lead to depression , physical consequences and possibly alcoholism , all which take their toll on mental health .
#Text=Emotional Maintenance
#Text=Build self-confidence .
#Text=Identify your strengths and your weaknesses .
#Text=Play to your strengths , accept compliments and do n't indulge in negative thoughts .
#Text=Build a support system .
#Text=Relationships with family and friends must be maintained , and many are strengthened through sharing life 's high and low points .
#Text=Share your emotions with the people you trust and encourage them to confide in you .
#Text=Keep track of your moods with a journal or conversation .
#Text=Self-reflection can help you identify times when you are prone to mood shifts .
#Text=This can help you to recognize the warning signs of stress , anxiety and depression and possibly prevent them .
#Text=Manage stress through relaxation methods .
#Text=Although exercise , support systems and sleep can help you manage stress , you should also find a way to limit the effects on your body and mind .
#Text=Massage , meditation , yoga , baths , writing and walking can help you to manage stress before it develops into anxiety .
#Text=Positive Lifestyle Changes
#Text=Find a creative pursuit .
#Text=Studies show that making or being creative outside of your job can help give you a feeling of accomplishment and improve quality of life .
#Text=Try gardening , writing , playing an instrument , drawing , painting or crafting as a hobby .
#Text=Manage your finances .
#Text=Money issues are 1 of the largest causes of stress and anxiety .
#Text=Take the time to create a reasonable budget .
#Text=Plan leisure time every day .
#Text=Many people become overwhelmed with work or family responsibility .
#Text=Care for yourself like you care for others , by planning " playtime . "
#Text=Good adult " playtime " activities include reading a book , talking to a friend , going for a walk , listening to music or walking .
#Text=Add laughter and positive feedback by going out with friends or joining a book club or knitting bee .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Try volunteering to improve mood .
#Text=Giving unselfishly to others can improve your quality of life .
#Text=You can feel even more satisfied with volunteer work than with paid work .
#Text=Consider getting a pet .
#Text=If you have the means to take care of an animal , you can benefit from the unconditional love and support a pet can give .
#Text=Studies have shown that making eye contact with your dog can release oxytocin , a mood-lifting brain chemical .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Consult a doctor or mental health professional immediately if you feel overwhelmed with anxiety or depression .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Sunlight
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Exercise
#Text=Healthy food
#Text=Family and friends
#Text=Journal
#Text=Creative hobby
#Text=Leisure activities
#Text=Pet ( optional )
#Text=Volunteer work
